newsitem.title: USA: U.S. West Coast late prods stay weak with NYMEX.
newsitem.headline: U.S. West Coast late prods stay weak with NYMEX.

text.p: U.S. West Coast spot product prices stayed weak in a subdued Monday market, with few bids seen amid a sharp sell-off in NYMEX prices, brokers said.
A cargo of Los Angeles CARB gasoline was heard sold at 72 cents a gallon, a 1.50-cent drop since Friday, with no bids reported.

Conventional gasoline in L.A. was talked between 66 and 67 cents a gallon, down one cent from Friday, with NYMEX April crude oil putting pressure on local spot trade as it fell 68 cents to $20.71 a barrel.
Outright prices for San Francisco gasoline were fell in line with the L.A. market Monday, and stood two cents a gallon lower than L.A. grades.
Jet fuel was talked one cent a gallon lower at 67/68 cents a gallon in Los Angeles, with other distillates also falling a cent on the day.
